summary: This bill, HR 4292, establishes a Congressional Task Force on Voting Rights of United States Citizen Residents of Territories. The 15-member task force will investigate impediments to voting rights in US territories, focusing on federal elections and House representation. The task force will issue a status update within 180 days and a comprehensive report within a year, including recommendations for changes. It will consult with territorial governments and utilize existing congressional resources, terminating after the report's release.
